00010 #ifndef BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_DETAIL_FUNCTOR_NEW_ER_2010_HPP
00011 #define BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_DETAIL_FUNCTOR_NEW_ER_2010_HPP
00012 #include <memory>
00013 #include <boost/preprocessor/repetition/repeat_from_to.hpp>
00014 #include <boost/preprocessor/repetition/enum_params.hpp>
00015 #include <boost/preprocessor/repetition/enum_binary_params.hpp>
00016 #include <boost/range/reference.hpp>
00017 #include <boost/type_traits/remove_cv.hpp>
00018 #include <boost/mpl/always.hpp>
00019 #include <boost/assign/v2/detail/type_traits/container/value.hpp>
00020 #include <boost/assign/v2/detail/config/limit_arity.hpp>
00021 #include <boost/assign/v2/detail/functor/crtp_unary_and_up.hpp>
00022 
00023 namespace boost{
00024 namespace assign{ 
00025 namespace v2{
00026 namespace functor_aux{
00027 
00028         template<typename T>
00029         class new_ : public functor_aux::crtp_unary_and_up< 
00030         functor_aux::new_<T>, 
00031         boost::mpl::always<T*> 
00032     >
00033         {
00034         typedef T* ptr_;
00035                 typedef functor_aux::new_<T> this_;
00036         typedef boost::mpl::always< ptr_ > meta_result_;
00037         typedef functor_aux::crtp_unary_and_up<this_, meta_result_> super_;
00038          
00039         public:
00040         
00041         typedef ptr_ result_type;
00042         
00043                 new_(){}
00044     
00045                 result_type operator()()const{ return new T(); } 
00046 
00047                 using super_::operator();
00048 
00049 #define MACRO(z, N, data) \
00050     template<BOOST_PP_ENUM_PARAMS(N, typename T)> \
00051     result_type impl( BOOST_PP_ENUM_BINARY_PARAMS(N, T, &_) )const{ \
00052         return new T( BOOST_PP_ENUM_PARAMS(N, _) ); \
00053     } \
00054 
00055 BOOST_PP_REPEAT_FROM_TO(
00056         1,
00057     BOOST_PP_INC(BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_LIMIT_ARITY),
00058     MACRO,
00059     ~
00060 )
00061 #undef MACRO
00062         
00063         };
00064 
00065         template<typename V>
00066     struct deduce_new_
00067     {
00068         typedef typename container_type_traits::value<V>::type value_;
00069         typedef functor_aux::new_<value_> type;
00070         static type call(){ return functor_aux::new_<value_>(); }
00071     };
00072 
00073 // --- For testing only --- // TODO remove foo from this file.
00074 
00075 struct foo
00076 {
00077     int i;
00078     
00079     foo() : i(0)
00080     { }
00081     foo( int i ) : i(i)
00082     { }
00083     foo( int i, int ) : i(i)
00084     { }
00085     foo( const char*, int i, int ) : i(i)
00086     { }
00087 
00088     virtual ~foo()
00089     { }
00090 };
00091 
00092 struct foo_bar : foo
00093 {
00094     foo_bar( int i ) : foo(i)
00095     { }
00096     
00097     foo_bar( int i, const char* )
00098     { }
00099 };
00100 
00101 inline bool operator<( const foo& l, const foo& r )
00102 {
00103     return l.i < r.i;
00104 }
00105     
00106 }// functor_aux
00107 namespace result_of{
00108 
00109         template<typename T>
00110         struct new_
00111     {
00112         typedef functor_aux::new_<T> type;
00113     };
00114 
00115 }// result_of
00116 
00117         template<typename T>
00118         typename result_of::new_<T>::type
00119     new_()
00120     {
00121         typedef typename result_of::new_<T>::type result_;
00122         return result_();
00123     }
00124                 
00125 }// v2
00126 }// assign
00127 }// boost
